instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-2879: What is 820-2879? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.U7000: What is U7000? U7000 refers to the ISL6258 or ISL6259 charging IC on Macbooks from 2008-2012.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.PP3V42_G3H: What is PP3V42_G3H? PP3V42_G3H is a power rail present when the machine is in a G3H global system hardware off state and is the first rail that should be generated in Macbooks that use it. .
definitions.SMC_RESET_L: What is SMC_RESET_L? SMC_RESET_L puts the SMC into reset mode when it is low, _L means the signal is present when voltage is low. The SMC being in reset mode keeps it from running..
definitions.SMC_BC_ACOK: What is SMC_BC_ACOK? This is identical to CHGR_ACOK. This will come out of the ISL6258 or ISL6259 charging chip when CHGR_ACIN & CHGR_DCIN are present, and is necessary for the onewire circuit to begin working. On most Macbooks, CHGR_ACOK needs to be present in order for PP3V42_G3H to flow to the onewire circuit so that the circuitry that allows the charger to communicate with the SMC will turn on.  .
definitions.CHGR_ACIN: What is CHGR_ACIN? CHGR_ACIN is a signal that is created by a voltage divider between the charger and ground that goes into the ISL6258, ISL6259, ISL9239, or ISL9240 chip that creates PPBUS_G3H. It is necessary for SMC_BC_ACOK & CHGR_ACOK to be present so that the onewire circuit is told to turn on & allow the SMC to speak to the charger..
definitions.CHGR_DCIN: What is CHGR_DCIN? CHGR_DCIN comes directly from charger into ISL6258 or ISL6259, the resistor before it can be blown when there are surges. Should be checked when PPBUS_G3H is missing.
definitions.R7005: What is R7005? resistor between charger and CHGR_DCIN pin of ISL6259, if CHGR_DCIN is low then this resistor is probably blown. When PPBUS_G3H is low or missing this is something to check if your model has CHGR_DCIN along R7005. .
definitions.R7051: What is R7051? Current sense resistor between battery current sense shunt resistor and ISL6259. When these resistors fail the ISL6259 cannot gauge how much current is being sent to or drawn from the battery, which will cause the ISL6259 to stop drawing/sending power to the battery as a safety precaution. Symptoms are low voltage on PPBUS_G3H, quarter fan spin, boot looping, or battery not charging..
definitions.R7021: What is R7021? Current sense resistor between charger current sense shunt resistor and ISL6259. When these resistors fail the ISL6259 cannot gauge how much current is being drawn from the charger, which will cause the ISL6259 to stop drawing power from the charger as a safety precaution. Symptoms are low voltage on PPBUS_G3H around 4v, quarter fan spin, or battery not charging..
definitions.R7052: What is R7052? Current sense resistor between battery current sense shunt resistor and ISL6259. When these resistors fail the ISL6259 cannot gauge how much current is being sent to or drawn from the battery, which will cause the ISL6259 to stop drawing/sending power to the battery as a safety precaution. Symptoms are low voltage on PPBUS_G3H, quarter fan spin, boot looping, or battery not charging..
definitions.R5280: What is R5280? Pullup resistor between PP3V42_G3H and SMBUS_SMC_5_G3_SDA which is a data line that allows the SMC to communicate with the battery and the battery charging chip. This line is necessary for the battery to be recognized. With red probe on ground, diode mode should measure 0.441 on pin 2 of this resistor. .
definitions.R5281: What is R5281? Pullup resistor between PP3V42_G3H and SMBUS_SMC_5_G3_SCL which is a data line that allows the SMC to communicate with the battery and the battery charging chip. This line is necessary for the battery to be recognized. With red probe on ground, diode mode should measure 0.441 on pin 2 of this resistor. .

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2879</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No power green light ok no orange light
threads.message: Resistance to GND on PPBUS? Check <CHIP>U7200</CHIP> area too

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2879</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No power green light ok no orange light
threads.message:
resistance to GND on PPBUS line 1,06M and decrease, resistance around <CHIP>U7200</CHIP> area fine

board startup only if battery plugged with charger, ppbus at 10,95 with battery plugged

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2879</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No power green light ok no orange light
threads.message:
now replaced <CHIP>U7000</CHIP> board startup without battery with ppbus 12,25V

but battery no charging and no orange light, no power from battery 

<SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> line battery only 10,80V

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2879</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No power green light ok no orange light
threads.message:
In diode mode, red probe to ground, black probe to pin 2 of <RESISTOR>R5280</RESISTOR> , what do you get? Same for pin 2 of <RESISTOR>R5281</RESISTOR>.

Either the <CHIP>U7000</CHIP> you put on is bad, The SMC is bad, or the battery indicator thing is bad. <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> being 12.25v means the SMC data line with the <CHIP>U7000</CHIP> and the battery isn't working.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2879</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No power green light ok no orange light
threads.message: Is battery indicator doing anything when pressed?

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2879</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No power green light ok no orange light
threads.message:
In diode mode pin 2 of <RESISTOR>R5280</RESISTOR> 0,551V and for pin 2 of <RESISTOR>R5281</RESISTOR> 0,537V

battery indicator not work when pressed, work from another good board know

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2879</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No power green light ok no orange light
threads.message: Replace <CHIP>U7000</CHIP>. Measure both data pins of the battery before placing back a NEW <CHIP>U7000</CHIP>.
